title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2: OPTIMAL NUTRITION PRACTICES& SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2024, key target populations (adolescent girls, and pregnant & lactating women and children <59 months and care givers) in 6 high priority provinces benefit from the use of optimal nutrition practices and services., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition In Early Childhood (Covid), Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children (0â€“5 years), adolescent girls and pregnant and lactating women benefit from improved feeding, nutrition services and practices, including in emergencies.

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support, including work on the Code of Marketing of Breastmilk Substitutes
Diet diversity in early childhood, including complementary feeding, multiple micronutrient powders and lipid-based nutrition supplements
Maternal nutrition, including counselling, micronutrient supplementation and dietary support
Micronutrient supplementation in early childhood, including vitamin A supplementation and deworming prophylaxis
Salt iodization and other large-scale food fortification

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, key target populations (adolescent girls, and pregnant & lactating women and children <59 months and care givers) in 6high priority provinces benefit from the use of optimal nutrition practices and services.

description.narrative: In 2021 UNICEF provided technical and financial support for the development of;guidelines for early child development and maternal nutrition.;Vitamin A supplementation was;provided to;8,059,568 children;aged;6-59 months during the 2021 first round which represents ;41 % of the target. Based on routine data, Breastfeeding rates improved;from;63%;(2020);to;72.9%;(2021).;733,503;mothers of children;under 2;years;received counselling IYCF practices,;which improved;minimum diet;diversity;to 29.9%;(27%in 2020).;Growth monitoring;extend;in;408;health zones;in 23;provinces.;9,484;community animation cells were set up for the implementation of community activities.;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022
